intro: Microtropis cathayensis, commonly known as the Chinese microtropis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Microtropis cathayensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
